website_summaries.verdict: Choose this model if affordability and practicality are your top concerns, as it offers a simple design with a large bladder for a surprisingly inexpensive price.
pros: Stands out for the user-friendly, minimalist design that's lightweight and easy to adjust to provide an excellent fit for most users
Nice design for running and long hikes
Fits up to 2 liters of water, and includes the bladder
cons: Lacks space and lots of pockets, but does have room for a few small items like snacks or keys

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: I received this product a few months ago. When I first received the product, the packaging was excellent. I use this when I go on my bike rides. - Has room for a snack or two. - Holds plenty of water and keeps the temperature. - At first, the water tasted like plastic because of the bladder. After a few uses and washes, The taste faded away. - Not heavy on the shoulders. It is lightweight. I would recommend this product for anyone who is looking for something small, sleek and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Darrien

customer_reviews.title: Will be effective if you are not demanding.
customer_reviews.text: Bite valve is difficult. Does not provide much water from valve. Tube is difficult to route. Not much storage for other things. Is light weight. Has small storage space. Can be good for specific users. You get what you pay for here. If you're not picky or demanding; you'll enjoy this.
customer_reviews.author: CCRox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! I'd suggest buying a specialized long brush to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Isn't bulky yet it's got an external mesh pocket for storing whatever knick knack. Use it for hiking, backpacking, snowboarding, trips to the beach. Excellent! I'd suggest buying a specialized long brush to clean the tube, as mold forms inside it over time.
customer_reviews.author: Coz

customer_reviews.title: Not so much impressive
customer_reviews.text: The backpack itself is good quality for the price, but I couldn't get rid of the plastic taste from the blader. I washed it, soaked it, used mild soap, rinsed multiple times. No matter what I did, water still tastes like plastic. Also, it is not easy to suck the water from blader, which makes you struggle, especially if you are using this for biking.
customer_reviews.author: Aiyoub

customer_reviews.title: Great for marathon training
customer_reviews.text: Have worn on runs up to 16 miles for marathon training and it’s great. I’m 5’7” and it fits well and is comfortable. Very good value.

customer_reviews.title: fits pretty snug
customer_reviews.text: I got this so i would have water for long runs and could put my phone away without an arm strap. It fullfills those goals. I will say it is difficult to pull water through the straw, or at least more so than a camelback. Im 6'3 220 and i have to loosen the straps to the maximum size and its a little snug. so if you have a bigger torso it might not fit. otherwise I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Trader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running
customer_reviews.text: Really great pack. My 2L Camelbak bladder fits perfectly. It does come with a 2L bladder but I'll use that one as a back up. Pack is low profile and comfortable and secure well. Glad it comes with the waist belt so there is no jostling around when running with this pack. Very good value.
customer_reviews.author: The True King In The North

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hydro Pack
customer_reviews.text: Great product that kept me hydrated! I used this on a 450 mile week long bike ride and it was very useful for holding water. The small front pouch was great for holding small items like sunscreen, a phone, and a wallet. Is this the same build quality as a camelback? Not 100% but it's close and for the price, you can't beat it. Would I buy it again? Absolutely!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Schmit

customer_reviews.title: The bladder is almost unusable.
customer_reviews.text: My main complaint, as others have noted, is the terrible smell of the water bladder. It significantly affects the taste of the water. It's bad enough that I don't feel comfortable using it any longer. I have washed and rinsed it multiple times but it has not improved. We have transitioned to just using the pack to carry small items and snacks on hikes. Eventually I plan to buy a different bladder, but the original is pretty bad. I gave it two stars because the backpack is actually pretty well made.
customer_reviews.author: CubFan

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This hydration pack is amazing for it's price point. I noticed that when I was in a rush to drink water that the mouth piece would come off, but that wasn't an issue as I could easily pop it back on and it would work perfectly again. Considering that this pack was only about $20, you really can't beat that. My pack did leak a little bit initially, but this was fixed by tightening the part where the bladder and hose met. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for an alternative to a camelbak as this one works just as well for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes G Rivas

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a petite woman and I was worried it would be too long or too bulky for me but it fits perfect! I wear it riding my bike and hiking. It holds a good amount of water. I have yet to run out of water on long rides. The extra storage works great for my keys and other small things I carry with me. It's super comfortable, and fits close to the body. It works perfect for me!!
customer_reviews.author: JennyJenJennifer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to using a hydration pack. I run on average 3-4 miles at a time in different locations and I LOVE this pack. 2L is plenty for me and I usually share with my dog that runs along side of me. The straps are comfortable with various shirts/tank tops without skin irritation. The bag doesn’t slide and move around but the water does obviously slosh around. It is easy to clean and easy to fill. I LOVE the pouch for my keys and dog bowl that I carry with me. It also has a whistle in the clip! It is a great buy! Totally recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these for my son and I as we were running a Spartan Beast. Very comfortable pack and really didn't notice it while on the course other than when I didn't get low enough a couple times in the barbed wire obstacle and snagged it. Held up good and look forward to continue using in future runs.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Good price. Holds phone and other small items. Stays in place while running and is adjustable for different body sizes.
customer_reviews.author: A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Good pack for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good pack for the price. There isn't much room in the little pocket on the back, but it's enough to hold a tiny little baggy with bandages, moleskin, neosporin, as well as my phone, wallet, and keys. Some people claimed that the end leaks, and this is true only if you leave the valve open. After I take a drink I'll push the mouthpiece in to close off the valve, and then squeeze the mouthpiece to squirt the remaining water out of the mouthpiece.
customer_reviews.author: Jared N

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear for running, doesn't bounce around
customer_reviews.text: And a pocket for the truck keys and phone! No weird plastic taste like I've read about, straps real easy to adjust so no flopping around like I expected. This was really much better than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Macy

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: This thing is seriously terrible. It leaks the entire time and you have to suck soooo hard to get the liquid to come out. I wouldn't even buy this again if it were half the price. It makes you even more out of breath to try to use it. I gave it to my father in law and he has to have his wife push on the back to get it to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Colson Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful hydration pack.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for trail marathon training and running. Very light and durable nylon material. It sticks tight to the body with an adjustable waist strap and chest strap. Outer mesh pocket keeps food and gear dry [from sweat] and secure. Although it comes with a 2 liter hydration bladder, I switched it out for my Platypus 2 liter pack because the complimentary one would slosh around full or near empty--the Platypus was very stable because it has an inner membrane that connects the front and back sides of the bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I'm a 5'7" 120 lb woman and it fit great - no bouncing around and I hardly noticed I ...
customer_reviews.text: Took my new pack for an inaugural 10 mile run today. I'm a 5'7" 120 lb woman and it fit great - no bouncing around and I hardly noticed I was wearing it. This was my first time using a hydration pack and it was way more comfortable than the waist packs or hand held water bottles I've previously used for long runs. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: winston1

customer_reviews.title: Broke 2 hours after first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 2 day daytime festival. For the price, if it only lasted those two days it would've been fine. However, the flow of the tube connecting to the bladder broke 2 hours in on the first day... The mouth piece to the tube also broke off. It was now useless, the only function was to hold water bottles. If you need a light weight backpack to get through security then it this will work for you, but don't expect to use it as a hydration pack.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Reutemann

customer_reviews.title: Sprung a Leak
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the design of this bag and blatter, but it totally failed me on my first use of it. I filled it up and took it out for a backpacking trip, and before we even began hiking it sprang a leak in the bottom. Idk if it was a manufacturer defect in the seem on this particular bag, but it did not work at all for me. I was left with no water blatter for the rest of my backpacking trip.
customer_reviews.author: Craig pope

customer_reviews.title: Training/marathon trail/road runs.Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I'm training for a marathon and this is lightweight, affordable, and adjustable for me. I have a big bust so that was a plus. It comes with an emergency whistle attached. And there's little stretchy slot to stick pepper spray or a energy bar! Only thing I would wish for for this is more small pockets but you can attach carry ons so that's ok. I only use water in it because cleaning it would be a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our kids (14, 12, 8). Used for hiking. (We do a lot of hiking) These are more reasonable for the price when compared to camel backs and they hold up well to the abuse of kids. Very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: BurnWhiteFlag

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the $$
customer_reviews.text: My son (9) LOveS his hydration pack. His current bike doesn't allow for a water bottle cage so we've tried to find a solution and we have. Very nice. Well made has stood up to the rigors of a 9 yo boy and is still alive so 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack, but not bladder
customer_reviews.text: The backpack itself is great. Very lightweight and straps on to the body nicely. Also, the mesh front pocket is great for storing keys, wallets, glasses, etc. One major flaw I found with this purchase was the bladder. Even after rinsing the bladder with vingar, water, and even lemon water, the water would takes like the plastic and rubber. Definitely not what I want to taste on a hike when its scorching hot outside. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K

customer_reviews.title: Began leaking at one month
customer_reviews.text: The first three uses were flawless. It functioned as expected. Unfortunately, after a month it began to leak where the hydration tube connects to the bladder. Time to start looking for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: briggs

customer_reviews.title: As as good s as I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Wished I would’ve gone for a 3 liter, but this product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Basspro

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, very comfortable. It is easy to drink from and has a small storage pocket for those necessities. I used it for my half marathon training and when I ran the half marathon. Had no issues and it was very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jill E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Save ur time and money.. shop elsewhere for camelpack
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product.. received for free and still wouldn’t pay 10$ for this POS. Torn when arrived and leaking.
customer_reviews.author: CmeNow

customer_reviews.title: easy to fill and to disassemble for cleaning and drying
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an inexpensive, quality hydration system, easy to fill and to disassemble for cleaning and drying. It functions great, seems to be of high quality and I expect it to be durable,the bladder feels good as well, however it did have a very plastic taste, a good rinse will fix the issue. My personal use is when riding a motorcycle. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: B. L.

customer_reviews.title: The backpack itself is great, perfect size for fitting a bladder and throwing ...
customer_reviews.text: The backpack itself is great, perfect size for fitting a bladder and throwing in some sunscreen/wallet/keys in the front pouch. I used it for day hiking in Costa Rica- it was small and breathable enough that it felt fine in the 90 degree and humid weather. My complaint is with the bladder itself. I actually only needed the backpack because I already own a bladder, but out of convenience just kept the one it came with in the pack. The mouthpiece broke within the first day of use.
customer_reviews.author: newhoc

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice pack. Small but convient and pretty simple. Just what the friend needed when I have it to him for a gift
customer_reviews.author: tat1957

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality Sewing at Important Connection Points
customer_reviews.text: Low quality at some spots. After just two uses the stitching has come out where the fabric meets the strap on one side and on the other side the fabric has pulled out from under the stitching. I will reinforce this with a needle and thread, and I expect I can continue to use it. For the price, it's more hassle to send back.
customer_reviews.author: M.R. Breen

customer_reviews.title: It was the perfect size for me since I'm only 5'2
customer_reviews.text: Been looking at all different kind of pack for outdoor and hiking and I came across this one. It was the perfect size for me since I'm only 5'2. I love how simple it was since I didn't want to carry a lot of stuff on me. I haven't try it out yet since my hiking trip is coming up and I'm hoping it won't disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: MaiiNou

customer_reviews.title: Overall great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to disassemble, clean, and has a little extra space. Not the greatest looking but is more than good for what we got it for and it's not like you have to look at it on your bike all day. Great price, too.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Pass on buying this
customer_reviews.text: The Teton Sports Trailrunner 2.0 is below average. I regret this purchase, and I would pass on buying it. No matter how many times I wash it out, the water ends up tasting funny. I have to take the mouth piece off to drink the water, as opening it per the instructions does not help.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Nolen

customer_reviews.title: It’s cheap but it’s cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the package I rinsed it out and loaded it up with water. First go around leaked all down my back. I’m never going to use this. Don’t waste the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clark

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky for runs.
customer_reviews.text: Too bulky for running. The buckles on the side are positioned in a bad place for rubbing your arms. Pockets are all in the back so you have to remove the pack to access anything. Great pack for walking or theme parking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my adult daughter. She said that she it but I have no other info.
customer_reviews.author: Kay C

customer_reviews.title: Good product.!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on several occasions last year and it keeps the water cold up to 2-3 hours if you do 1/2 ice. Well worth the price so I bought two. Don't go anywhere on vacation without this if I plan an walking for a few hours outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: RICK L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, very good value for the price. Keep in mind that it is not intended to be a carry all as the pocket on the back is pretty small. If you are looking for a 70 oz hydration backpack with a small footprint at a great price, this is the one for you. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: OJP

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my son and he absolutely loves how practical it is. Great for hiking, trips in the car, or long walks. Cleaning is not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: LissiT

customer_reviews.title: Shabby Construction
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this less than 3 months ago to train for a marathon. It functions well in terms of hydration but I gave it 2 stars because the quality of the construction is shabby. There is already a tear on the bottom and I only use it once a week on longer runs. It's too bad it was not made better because the overall design is good.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Nice hydration pack for hiking, summer runs, and OCR races.
customer_reviews.text: Used this hydration pack for the Spartan Super in Asheville, NC and it worked out just fine. It was inexpensive and I had no issues with it for the duration of the race. I also use it for long distance runs during the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Miller

customer_reviews.title: Go with the Camelbak brand instead - not worth the savings
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these one year ago, and used them 3-4 times prior to our 5 day hike on the Camino de Santiago in Spain 2 weeks ago. The bladder inside the pack is terrible. I was never able to easily drink water from the mouthpiece, and during the 2nd day of our hike (15 miles), the bladder just gave up and leaked all over my backpack, drenching everything inside. Very disappointed. I recommend going with the Camelbak brand. Our daughter has had hers for years and has never experienced any problems with it, with regard to drinking or having it leak.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH N.

customer_reviews.title: very good.
customer_reviews.text: This camelback clone works very, very well. It has a good system for holding the bladder securely in the case. The backpack part is functional and secure. I liked this item so much I bought another for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Ronzo

customer_reviews.title: Good product w/ great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this on long runs for the past month. Today I noticed a seam had ripped and contacted Teton Sports to file a warranty claim. Very simple process and they are sending me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Slow leak does not make this product good to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this product a few times because it leaks slowly. I have tried tightening the tube to the bag, but nothing works. My back ends up wet. Besides that, it is a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Merriam

customer_reviews.title: meh, get something with a better bladder
customer_reviews.text: would be 5 stars but it leaks because the oring on the bladder, and water doesn't flow that awesomely through the tube either way. Will be getting new bladder and keeping pack.
customer_reviews.author: zomgwtfbbq

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product good price
customer_reviews.text: Great product . Excellent finish,very good quality. It doesn't leak at all ,tested at a long and ruff mountain bike ride.Great price and I will recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Luigi

customer_reviews.title: Great for hikes and home
customer_reviews.text: I use water backpack while cutting the grass. Don't get dehydrated any more.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mclain

customer_reviews.title: good hydration backpack
customer_reviews.text: good hydration backpack. Holds a good amount of water and does keep it fairly cold. You must clean it out though because you will get that old plastic water taste if you dont
customer_reviews.author: Travis Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Bladder leaked immediately the first time I filled it up
customer_reviews.text: Bladder leaked immediately the first time I filled it up. I am waiting on the replacement, and will update this review once I receive the second one. The mouth guard also seems to be pretty flimsy. The backpack itself is nice and slim.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D

customer_reviews.title: Many uses; also keeps you hydrated.
customer_reviews.text: After thorough cleaning of bag, works awesome! Also used the backpack (without hydration pouch) as a tackle holder for wading the flats in Tampa Bay. Orange chest buckle is also a whistle! Sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, have used it for 2 Spartan races ...
customer_reviews.text: Good buy, have used it for 2 Spartan races now and held up fine, planning on using again this year. I guess only suggestion would be a waterproof/closed pocket maybe to keep keys or phone/cards in but otherwise very good, not too heavy when full, was glad to have it with me
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Light and fits well
customer_reviews.text: Almost don't realize it's there. Just enough water capacity for an hour or so jog/walk. Well constructed and has reflective areas for night/morning street safety.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great value won't hold much other than the water and an extra bottle of something
customer_reviews.text: I like this hydration pack. It's certainly a good value in my opinion. My minor gripes would be it's hard to hold it while refilling it and there isn't much room in it for anything but the bladder and a bottle of water.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Peters

customer_reviews.title: very light weight and the strap placement was perfect. The net in the front doesn't fit much ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well, very light weight and the strap placement was perfect. The net in the front doesn't fit much I was able to fit my cell, gloves and 2 bars but that worked for me. The only issue I had was the spout it kinda just hangs there but once I tucked it in I had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie N.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty sure I had a defective one the hose didn’t work and it kept leaking. They should have instructions or some sort of direction.
customer_reviews.author: Autum

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hydration pack for Spartan Races/OCR!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a hydration pack for the Hawaii Spartan Beast race. This pack exceeded expectations! I have used it on several obstacle course races and it is still going strong. I highly recommend this hydration pack for long obstacle course races. The shoulder padding could be better, but I really didn't notice any discomfort wearing it. I also got it at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Marc in PDX

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for hydration and a few snacks. Durable and well made. Great for my teenage scouts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: It came with one of the bungee strings cut. Also the spout to drink from was not there. It was just a hose. The package had a sticker that said, "inspected and repackaged." Obviously that is not true. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! My son can't wait to use this on his biking adventures in the spring! Good quality and just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: lisa-k

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, easy to use while running
customer_reviews.text: Ran a spartan race and this came in super handy, not heavy and not restrictive at all. very comfortable and served its purpose!!!
customer_reviews.author: Hav0c2all

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for trailrunning! Small & compact. The price is also right.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Taylor

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, no funny taste, and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday and have been testing for leaks - none found! Also filled with soapy water and rinsed well. No funny tastes. The storage areas will be sufficient for me as a day hiker. Very pleased with this purchase and the price!
customer_reviews.author: Online Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Great for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the cost. Very convenient, not cumbersome, straightforward. Not much room for storage - just the mesh pocket on the outside front, but that can be inferred from the description and reviews. Enough room for keys, a granola bar or two, ect. Not problematic. We bought two and unfortunately, the bladder for one began leaking after 2-3 hikes. Other than that, they've been great!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I use this on hikes light enough that a full hiking backpack is unnecessary and for that it works great. The small picket in the front is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cliu

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: This hydration backpack works very well and at a far friendlier price point than similar Camelbak products. It has been easy to install and remove, easy to fill and operate. As others have noted, the tube is pretty long and can dangle. I simply pull up at the shoulder, creating a "loop" as I ride along.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved this. easy to use and holds a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: Saved my life in Machu Picchu. Loved this. easy to use and holds a lot of water and more things.
customer_reviews.author: Yotuel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small pack for running, hoping it would fit my small frame. But, no, it was made for a big person and I have it cinched up so much that I have flying straps and big loops. The water bladder mouth piece opens by sliding it out, but it is not smooth. And I find it hard to drink, so hard I nearly have to stop running to take a drink. Either I can't figure out how to squeeze the mouthpiece just right or I don't have enough suction power. But the reason I wrote this review is that the water bladder started leaking at the bottom connection after 4 uses. There are better brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: KS.Bainbridge

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Got this one for my dad, He agrees Awesome product. You almost forget its there and the storage mesh works great. Hiked 5 miles and explored to caves total of 800ft elevation change. The pack was never in the way never moved around.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: never leaks and keeps my fluid nice and cold
customer_reviews.text: I use this every weekend for trail running... never leaks and keeps my fluid nice and cold. comfortable fit, just love it
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Tighten the tube to the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Mine leaked from the bottom at first, but all you have to do is tighten the tube at the bottom of the bladder and it works fine. It is very ergonomic
customer_reviews.author: Joe Browning

customer_reviews.title: ... and leaks easier compared to camelbak but it sits comfortably and doesn't ride
customer_reviews.text: Bite valve takes some getting used to and leaks easier compared to camelbak but it sits comfortably and doesn't ride. It's been used mostly for races running races where my hands are free to mess with the bite valve, skiing or biking and that might be a major issue.
customer_reviews.author: Slimer

customer_reviews.title: My wife uses this when out on long trail rides ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses this when out on long trail rides with her horse. No, she hasn't taught the horse to use it yet, it's strictly for humans.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Ward

customer_reviews.title: the pocket is not as big as they advertise. ...
customer_reviews.text: the pocket is not as big as they advertise. I can probably fit my iphone in it but that's it.
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for how I run
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for how I run. Training for the Paris Marathon and wanted an unobtrusive backpack that held just enough stuff a few supplements, gloves, and an extra shirt. The bladder holds plenty of liquid. Love this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right size and seeming functionality, for the good price
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t hardcore used it yet but am delighted by it on reception and inspection
customer_reviews.author: Leslye Killian

customer_reviews.title: The mouthpiece comes off.
customer_reviews.text: Took it to Coachella and it worked until day 2 the mouth piece started falling off (I'm drug free so I wasn't chewing on it or anything) and poured water all over me every couple of hours. Finally decommissioned the thing at HARD Summer. I'm gonna spend 8 more bucks for an actual camelback for the upcoming festival season.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ito

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a good pack for the price , not the best for running, it flops around a good bit, but will work well on my hiking adventures
customer_reviews.author: jody mayer

customer_reviews.title: 2-Liter Hydration Bladder damaged
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the 2-Liter Hydration Bladder had a leak the first time used and past the return date.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good backpack, but don't use it with technical shirts
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable straps make it fit well, and you barely notice it when running. I only noticed one problem - the material doesn't work well with technical shirts. After a long run, my shirt was pilling as if it got in contact with velcro. No such problem with natural materials.
customer_reviews.author: If a tree falls in the woods

customer_reviews.title: no need to spend the big bucks
customer_reviews.text: Almost identical to the camel bak I was going to spend 70 on. Very happy with this purchase!! Even extra room for granola bars, ID and keys!
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Summer camp savior
customer_reviews.text: My son is using this for summer camp, he says its awesome and he loves it! Well made for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: and easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: It's light weight, and easy to carry. I didn't have a rubbery taste to the water like some of these other reviews
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The backpack is terrific. Fits well
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is terrific. Fits well. Straps hold it all securely during any and all activity. Great size balancing size while holding ample water supplies. Easy to clean. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert McClory

customer_reviews.title: don't be thirsty anymore! 😅
customer_reviews.text: Awesome was very please with it. It fulfills the purpose. You can place your little belongings in the space available and you ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: lito

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mountain Biking
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this purchase. Perfect for mountain biking where I don't wan't a bunch of stuff on my back but water and my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: D Mapes

customer_reviews.title: The slot in the mouthpiece is not large enough to allow good water flow and the mouthpiece cover came off my ...
customer_reviews.text: You pay for what you get. The slot in the mouthpiece is not large enough to allow good water flow and the mouthpiece cover came off my first time I used it. I debated getting this pack and in the long run wish I'd just put the money towards a higher quality pack.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what was expected! Very nice. Straps are a bit confusing, but all in all great product. Would buy from this seller again 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Haylee

customer_reviews.title: LOOK HERE
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pack a few times now and love it. Very durable and getting liquid from the mouthpiece is very easy. I cant wait to get some time to get get out and enjoy the outdoors again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It worked great! The only complaint is that it rubbed my ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great! The only complaint is that it rubbed my arm a little. It will be worse for the next race since it will be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Sinclair2

customer_reviews.title: Very bad product. Hard to get water out
customer_reviews.text: Very bad product. Hard to get water out. water tastes bad not drinkable even after several washings. Will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Will recommend it to others
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, mouth piece a little hard to get use to. Will recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Wright

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Liked it better than my husbands brand name one of these.
customer_reviews.author: KYBaseballMom

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: It was great for music fests and hiking. The only downside is that this is hard to clean/dry after each use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Wang

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Bladder was lightweight, easy to use and no leaks. Used it on a hiking trip and it was great for the excursion. It was a bit difficult to get water out but other than that, it was fine
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Threw it away after one use. You have to suck really really hard to get water to flow through. It doesn't matter what else it has going for it. If it doesn't fulfill its primary function, it's worthless.
customer_reviews.author: rocky mountain camper

customer_reviews.title: He loved that he could take a drink with out having ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old son to use for hikes with his Cub Scout Pack. He loved that he could take a drink with out having to ask me for his water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

product_meta.title: TETON Sports TrailRunner 2.0 Hydration Pack; Backpack for Hiking, Running and Cycling; Free 2-Liter Hydration Bladder
product_meta.description: Satisfy your thirst for adventure with the TrailRunner 2.0, by TETON Sports. This hydration backpack comes with a leakproof 2-Liter hydration bladder and is thoughtfully designed with you in mind. The 9” (23 cm) deep mesh pocket that will securely carry all the things you need on the trail. You can adjust the shoulder, chest, and waist straps to get a comfortable fit.
feature_bullets: SATISFY YOUR THIRST FOR ADVENTURE: Lightweight and comfortable hydration backpack; This pack is a terrific companion to keep you hydrated while running, cycling, hiking or any adventure outdoors
FREE HYDRATION BLADDER: 2-Liter; Durable, kink-free sip tube and push-lock cushioned bite valve; Large 2-inch (5 cm) opening for ice and easy cleaning
CUSTOMIZABLE COMFORT: Backpack for men, women, and youth; Adjusts to fit all frames; Comfortable mesh covered shoulder straps mean you can wear this pack for hours
TRUSTED QUALITY: Over 1,000 verified 5-star reviews testifying to the quality and design; Large mesh pocket for your wallet, phone, and snacks
TETON SPORTS PROMISE: Reach out to our AMAZING product support team if you have any questions or concerns; YOU CAN COUNT ON US to get you taken care of and back OUTDOORS with TETON Sports
